intro: Cremastosperma dolichocarpum, commonly known as the long-seeded senna, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its seeds are enclosed in elongated, woody pods, which contribute to its common name. The plant is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
